comments:
3.2 20050116
It is possible to get the following ClassCastException during marker updates.

This is because the refreshes are not IMarkers and should not be processed.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-01-10 16:00:48.468
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Process resource updates".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException
	at org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.MarkerView$MarkerProcessJob.getExistingMarkers(MarkerView.java:206)
	at org.eclipse.ui.views.markers.internal.MarkerView$MarkerProcessJob.run(MarkerView.java:169)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Is there any workaround for this, or patch available?  Also this is against 3.2 right?  The problem does not exist in version 3.1.1 does it?
Actually my build number is wrong - it is in 20060110 only and is not in any other build. 3.2 M4 or 3.1.1 should not have this issue.
*** Bug 123799 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This makes it impossible to work with I20060110 or greater for more than 30 minutes.
This is fixed in the nightly builds (which didn't run) as of 20050113 but I didn't close the bug yet as I was hoping to run with them
